member.name: M:Ical.Net.Calendar.AddTimeZone(Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.VTimeZone)
member.summary: Adds a time zone to the iCalendar. This time zone may then be used in date/time objects contained in the calendar.
member.returns: The time zone added to the calendar.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Calendar.Evaluate(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime,Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime)
member.summary:
Evaluates component recurrences for the given range of time.
For example, if you are displaying a month-view for January 2007, you would want to evaluate recurrences for Jan. 1, 2007 to Jan. 31, 2007 to display relevant information for those dates.
member.param: The beginning date/time of the range to test.
The end date/time of the range to test.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Calendar.Evaluate``1(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime,Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime)
member.summary: Evaluates component recurrences for the given range of time, for the type of recurring component specified.
member.typeparam: The type of component to be evaluated for recurrences.
member.param: The beginning date/time of the range to test.
The end date/time of the range to test.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Calendar.ClearEvaluation
member.summary: Clears recurrence evaluations for recurring components.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Calendar.GetOccurrences(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime)
member.summary: Returns a list of occurrences of each recurring component for the date provided ().
member.param: The date for which to return occurrences. Time is ignored on this parameter.
member.returns: A list of occurrences that occur on the given date ().

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Calendar.GetOccurrences(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime,Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime)
member.summary: Returns a list of occurrences of each recurring component that occur between and .
member.param: The beginning date/time of the range.
The end date/time of the range.
member.returns: A list of occurrences that fall between the dates provided.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Calendar.GetOccurrences``1(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime)
member.summary:
Returns all occurrences of components of type T that start on the date provided. All components starting between 12:00:00AM and 11:59:59 PM will be returned.
This will first Evaluate() the date range required in order to determine the occurrences for the date provided, and then return the occurrences.
member.param: The date for which to return occurrences.
member.returns: A list of Periods representing the occurrences of this object.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Calendar.GetOccurrences``1(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime,Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime)
member.summary: Returns all occurrences of components of type T that start within the date range provided. All components occurring between and will be returned.
member.param: The starting date range
The ending date range

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Calendar.Create``1
member.summary: Creates a typed object that is a direct child of the iCalendar itself. Generally, you would invoke this method to create an Event, Todo, Journal, VTimeZone, FreeBusy, or other base component type.
member.typeparam: The type of object to create
member.returns: An object of the type specified

member.returns: The time zone added to the calendar.

member.note:
TODO: Add support for the following properties:
Add support for the Organizer and Attendee properties
Add support for the Class property
Add support for the Geo property
Add support for the Priority property
Add support for the Related property
Create a TextCollection DataType for 'text' items separated by commas

member.name: P:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.CalendarEvent.DtStart
member.summary:
The start date/time of the event.
If the duration has not been set, but the start/end time of the event is available, the duration is automatically determined. Likewise, if the end date/time has not been set, but a start and duration are available, the end date/time will be extrapolated.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.CalendarEvent.DtEnd
member.summary:
The end date/time of the event.
If the duration has not been set, but the start/end time of the event is available, the duration is automatically determined. Likewise, if an end time and duration are available, but a start time has not been set, the start time will be extrapolated.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.CalendarEvent.Duration
member.summary:
The duration of the event.
If a start time and duration is available, the end time is automatically determined. Likewise, if the end time and duration is available, but a start time is not determined, the start time will be extrapolated from available information.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.CalendarEvent.End
member.summary: An alias to the DtEnd field (i.e. end date/time).

member.name: P:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.CalendarEvent.IsAllDay
member.summary: Returns true if the event is an all-day event.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.CalendarEvent.GeographicLocation
member.summary: The geographic location (lat/long) of the event.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.CalendarEvent.Location
member.summary: The location of the event.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.CalendarEvent.Resources
member.summary: Resources that will be used during the event. Conference room #2 Projector

member.name: P:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.CalendarEvent.Status
member.summary: The status of the event.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.CalendarEvent.Transparency
member.summary: The transparency of the event. In other words, whether or not the period of time this event occupies can contain other events (transparent), or if the time cannot be scheduled for anything else (opaque).

member.name: M:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.CalendarEvent.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an Event object, with an iCalObject (usually an iCalendar object) as its parent.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.CalendarEvent.OccursOn(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime)
member.summary:
Use this method to determine if an event occurs on a given date.
This event should be called only after the Evaluate method has calculated the dates for which this event occurs.
member.param: The date to test.
member.returns: True if the event occurs on the provided, False otherwise.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.CalendarEvent.OccursAt(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime)
member.summary: Use this method to determine if an event begins at a given date and time.
member.param: The date and time to test.
member.returns: True if the event begins at the given date and time

member.name: P:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.CalendarEvent.IsActive
member.summary: Determines whether or not the is actively displayed as an upcoming or occurred event.
member.returns: True if the event has not been cancelled, False otherwise.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.Todo.IsCompleted(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime)
member.summary:
Use this method to determine if a todo item has been completed. This takes into account recurrence items and the previous date of completion, if any.
This method evaluates the recurrence pattern for this TODO as necessary to ensure all relevant information is taken into account to give the most accurate result possible.
member.returns: True if the todo item has been completed

member.name: M:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.Todo.IsActive(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime)
member.summary: Returns 'True' if the todo item is Active as of . An item is Active if it requires action of some sort.
member.param: The date and time to test.
member.returns: True if the item is Active as of , False otherwise.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.CalendarComponents.Todo.IsCancelled
member.summary: Returns True if the todo item was cancelled.
member.returns: True if the todo was cancelled, False otherwise.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.CalendarProperty
member.summary: A class that represents a property of the itself or one of its components. It can also represent non-standard (X-) properties of an iCalendar component, as seen with many applications, such as with Apple's iCal. X-WR-CALNAME:US Holidays
member.remarks:
Currently, the "known" properties for an iCalendar are as follows:
ProdID
Version
CalScale
Method
There may be other, custom X-properties applied to the calendar, and X-properties may be applied to calendar components.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.FrequencyOccurrence
F:Ical.Net.RecurrenceRestrictionType.Default
member.summary: Same as RestrictSecondly.

member.name: F:Ical.Net.RecurrenceRestrictionType.NoRestriction
member.summary: Does not restrict recurrence evaluation - WARNING: this may cause very slow performance!

member.name: F:Ical.Net.RecurrenceRestrictionType.RestrictSecondly
member.summary: Disallows use of the SECONDLY frequency for recurrence evaluation

member.name: F:Ical.Net.RecurrenceRestrictionType.RestrictMinutely
member.summary: Disallows use of the MINUTELY and SECONDLY frequencies for recurrence evaluation

member.name: F:Ical.Net.RecurrenceRestrictionType.RestrictHourly
member.summary: Disallows use of the HOURLY, MINUTELY, and SECONDLY frequencies for recurrence evaluation

member.name: F:Ical.Net.RecurrenceEvaluationModeType.Default
member.summary: Same as ThrowException.

member.name: F:Ical.Net.RecurrenceEvaluationModeType.AdjustAutomatically
member.summary: Automatically adjusts the evaluation to the next-best frequency based on the restriction type. For example, if the restriction were IgnoreSeconds, and the frequency were SECONDLY, then this would cause the frequency to be adjusted to MINUTELY, the next closest thing.

member.name: F:Ical.Net.RecurrenceEvaluationModeType.ThrowException
member.summary: This will throw an exception if a recurrence rule is evaluated that does not meet the minimum restrictions. For example, if the restriction were IgnoreSeconds, and a SECONDLY frequency were evaluated, an exception would be thrown.

member.name: F:Ical.Net.CalendarMethods.Publish
member.summary: Used to publish an iCalendar object to one or more "Calendar Users". There is no interactivity between the publisher and any other "Calendar User". An example might include a baseball team publishing its schedule to the public.

member.name: F:Ical.Net.CalendarMethods.Request
member.summary: Used to schedule an iCalendar object with other "Calendar Users". Requests are interactive in that they require the receiver to respond using the reply methods. Meeting requests, busy-time requests, and the assignment of tasks to other "Calendar Users" are all examples. Requests are also used by the Organizer to update the status of an iCalendar object.

member.name: F:Ical.Net.CalendarMethods.Reply
member.summary: A reply is used in response to a request to convey Attendee status to the Organizer. Replies are commonly used to respond to meeting and task requests.

member.name: F:Ical.Net.CalendarMethods.Add
member.summary: Add one or more new instances to an existing recurring iCalendar object.

member.name: F:Ical.Net.CalendarMethods.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel one or more instances of an existing iCalendar object.

member.name: F:Ical.Net.CalendarMethods.Refresh
member.summary: Used by an Attendee to request the latest version of an iCalendar object.

member.name: F:Ical.Net.CalendarMethods.Counter
member.summary: Used by an Attendee to negotiate a change in an iCalendar object. Examples include the request to change a proposed event time or change the due date for a task.

member.name: F:Ical.Net.CalendarMethods.DeclineCounter
member.summary: Used by the Organizer to decline the proposed counter-proposal.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.AlarmOccurrence
member.summary: A class that represents a specific occurrence of an .
member.remarks: The contains the when the alarm occurs, the that fired, and the component on which the alarm fired.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.Attachment
member.summary: Attachments represent the ATTACH element that can be associated with Alarms, Journals, Todos, and Events. There are two kinds of attachments: 1) A string representing a URI which is typically human-readable, OR 2) A base64-encoded string that can represent anything

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.Attendee.SentBy
member.summary: SENT-BY, to indicate who is acting on behalf of the ATTENDEE

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.Attendee.CommonName
member.summary: CN: to show the common or displayable name associated with the calendar address

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.Attendee.DirectoryEntry
member.summary: DIR, to indicate the URI that points to the directory information corresponding to the attendee

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.Attendee.Type
member.summary: CUTYPE: the type of calendar user

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.Attendee.Members
member.summary: MEMBER: the groups the user belongs to

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.Attendee.Role
member.summary: ROLE: the intended role the attendee will have

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.Attendee.Rsvp
member.summary: RSVP, to indicate whether a reply is requested

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.Attendee.DelegatedTo
member.summary: DELEGATED-TO, to indicate the calendar users that the original request was delegated to

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.Attendee.DelegatedFrom
member.summary: DELEGATED-FROM, to indicate whom the request was delegated from

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.Attendee.Value
member.summary: Uri associated with the attendee, typically an email address

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.CalDateTime
member.summary:
The iCalendar equivalent of the .NET class.
In addition to the features of the class, the class handles time zone differences, and integrates seamlessly into the iCalendar framework.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.DataTypes.CalDateTime.#ctor(System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Specifying a `tzId` value will override `value`'s `DateTimeKind` property. If the time zone specified is UTC, the underlying `DateTimeKind` will be `Utc`. If a non-UTC time zone is specified, the underlying `DateTimeKind` property will be `Local`. If no time zone is specified, the `DateTimeKind` property will be left untouched.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.CalDateTime.AsSystemLocal
member.summary: Converts the date/time to the date/time of the computer running the program. If the DateTimeKind is Unspecified, it's assumed that the underlying Value already represents the system's datetime.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.CalDateTime.AsUtc
member.summary: Returns a representation of the DateTime in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.CalDateTime.TzId
member.summary: Setting the TzId to a local time zone will set Value.Kind to Local. Setting TzId to UTC will set Value.Kind to Utc. If the incoming value is null or whitespace, Value.Kind will be set to Unspecified. Setting the TzId will NOT incur a UTC offset conversion under any circumstances. To convert to another time zone, use the ToTimeZone() method.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.DataTypes.CalDateTime.ToTimeZone(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a representation of the IDateTime in the specified time zone

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.CalDateTime.AsDateTimeOffset
member.summary: Returns a DateTimeOffset representation of the Value. If a TzId is specified, it will use that time zone's UTC offset, otherwise it will use the system-local time zone.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.CalendarDataType
member.summary: An abstract class from which all iCalendar data types inherit.

member.summary: Copies values from the target object to the current object.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.DataTypes.CalendarDataType.Copy``1
member.summary: Creates a copy of the object.
member.returns: The copy of the object.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.EncodableDataType
member.summary: An abstract class from which all iCalendar data types inherit.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.GeographicLocation
member.summary: A class that represents the geographical location of an or item.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime.AsSystemLocal
member.summary: Converts the date/time to this computer's local date/time.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime.AsUtc
member.summary: Converts the date/time to UTC (Coordinated Universal Time)

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime.AsDateTimeOffset
member.summary: Returns a DateTimeOffset representation of the Value. If a TzId is specified, it will use that time zone's UTC offset, otherwise it will use the system-local time zone.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime.IsUtc
member.summary: Gets/sets whether the Value of this date/time represents a universal time.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime.TimeZoneName
member.summary: Gets the time zone name this time is in, if it references a time zone.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime.Value
member.summary: Gets/sets the underlying DateTime value stored. This should always use DateTimeKind.Utc, regardless of its actual representation. Use IsUtc along with the TZID to control how this date/time is handled.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime.HasDate
member.summary: Gets/sets whether or not this date/time value contains a 'date' part.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime.HasTime
member.summary: Gets/sets whether or not this date/time value contains a 'time' part.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.Organizer
member.summary: A class that represents the organizer of an event/todo/journal.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.Period
member.summary: Represents an iCalendar period of time.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.PeriodList
member.summary: An iCalendar list of recurring dates (or date exclusions)

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.RecurrencePattern
member.summary: An iCalendar representation of the RRULE property. https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5545#section-3.3.10

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.RecurrencePattern.Interval
member.summary: Specifies how often the recurrence should repeat. - 1 = every - 2 = every second - 3 = every third

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.RecurrencePattern.ByMinute
member.summary: The ordinal minutes of the hour associated with this recurrence pattern. Valid values are 0-59.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.RecurrencePattern.ByMonthDay
member.summary: The ordinal days of the month associated with this recurrence pattern. Valid values are 1-31.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.RecurrencePattern.ByYearDay
member.summary: The ordinal days of the year associated with this recurrence pattern. Something recurring on the first day of the year would be a list containing 1, and would also be New Year's Day.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.RecurrencePattern.ByWeekNo
member.summary: The ordinal week of the year. Valid values are -53 to +53. Negative values count backwards from the end of the specified year. A week is defined by ISO.8601.2004

member.name: P:Ical.Net.DataTypes.RecurrencePattern.ByMonth
member.summary: List of months in the year associated with this rule. Valid values are 1 through 12.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.RequestStatus
member.summary: A class that represents the return status of an iCalendar request.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.StatusCode
member.summary: An iCalendar status code.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.Trigger
member.summary: A class that is used to specify exactly when an component will trigger. Usually this date/time is relative to the component to which the Alarm is associated.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.UtcOffset
member.summary: Represents a time offset from UTC (Coordinated Universal Time).

member.name: T:Ical.Net.DataTypes.WeekDay
member.summary: Represents an RFC 5545 "BYDAY" value.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Evaluation.EventEvaluator.Evaluate(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Evaluates this event to determine the dates and times for which the event occurs. This method only evaluates events which occur between and ; therefore, if you require a list of events which occur outside of this range, you must specify a and which encapsulate the date(s) of interest.
For events with very complex recurrence rules, this method may be a bottleneck during processing time, especially when this method in called for a large number of events, in sequence, or for a very large time span.
member.param: The beginning date of the range to evaluate.
The end date of the range to evaluate.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.Evaluation.IEvaluator.Calendar
member.summary: The system calendar that governs the evaluation rules.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.Evaluation.IEvaluator.EvaluationStartBounds
member.summary: The start bounds of the evaluation. This gives the first date/time that is covered by the evaluation. This together with EvaluationEndBounds determines what time frames have already been evaluated, so duplicate evaluation doesn't occur.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.Evaluation.IEvaluator.EvaluationEndBounds
member.summary: The end bounds of the evaluation. See for more info.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.Evaluation.IEvaluator.Periods
member.summary: Gets a list of periods collected so far during the evaluation process.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.Evaluation.IEvaluator.AssociatedObject
member.summary: Gets the object associated with this evaluator.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Evaluation.IEvaluator.Clear
member.summary: Clears the evaluation, eliminating all data that has been collected up to this point. Since this data is cached as needed, this method can be useful to gather information that is guaranteed to not be out-of-date.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Evaluation.IEvaluator.Evaluate(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Evaluates this item to determine the dates and times for which it occurs/recurs. This method only evaluates items which occur/recur between and ; therefore, if you require a list of items which occur outside of this range, you must specify a and which encapsulate the date(s) of interest. This method evaluates using the as the beginning point. For example, for a WEEKLY occurrence, the determines the day of week that this item will recur on.
For events with very complex recurrence rules, this method may be a bottleneck during processing time, especially when this method is called for a large number of items, in sequence, or for a very large time span.
member.returns: A list of objects for each date/time when this item occurs/recurs.

member.name: T:Ical.Net.Evaluation.RecurrencePatternEvaluator
member.summary:
Much of this code comes from iCal4j, as Ben Fortuna has done an excellent job with the recurrence pattern evaluation there.
Here's the iCal4j license: ================== iCal4j - License ==================

IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT OWNER OR CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.

members.member: Returns a list of start dates in the specified period represented by this recur. This method includes a base date argument, which indicates the start of the fist occurrence of this recurrence. The base date is used to inject default values to return a set of dates in the correct format. For example, if the search start date (start) is Wed, Mar 23, 12:19PM, but the recurrence is Mon - Fri, 9:00AM - 5:00PM, the start dates returned should all be at 9:00AM, and not 12:19PM.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Evaluation.RecurringEvaluator.EvaluateRRule(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Evaulates the RRule component, and adds each specified Period to the Periods collection.
member.param: The beginning date of the range to evaluate.
The end date of the range to evaluate.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Evaluation.RecurringEvaluator.EvaluateRDate(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Evalates the RDate component, and adds each specified DateTime or Period to the Periods collection.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Evaluation.RecurringEvaluator.EvaluateExRule(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Evaulates the ExRule component, and excludes each specified DateTime from the Periods collection.
member.param: The beginning date of the range to evaluate.
The end date of the range to evaluate.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Evaluation.RecurringEvaluator.EvaluateExDate(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Evalates the ExDate component, and excludes each specified DateTime or Period from the Periods collection.
member.param: The beginning date of the range to evaluate.
The end date of the range to evaluate.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.ICopyable.CopyFrom(Ical.Net.ICopyable)
member.summary: Copies all relevant fields/properties from the target object to the current one.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.ICopyable.Copy``1
member.summary: Returns a deep copy of the current object. For the most part, this is only necessary when working with mutable reference types, (i.e. iCalDateTime). For most other types, it's unnecessary overhead. The pattern that identifies whether it's necessary to copy or not is whether arithmetic operations mutate fields or properties. iCalDateTime is a good example where + and - would otherwise change the Value of the underlying DateTime.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.IGetOccurrences.ClearEvaluation
member.summary: Clears a previous evaluation, usually because one of the key elements used for evaluation has changed (Start, End, Duration, recurrence rules, exceptions, etc.).

member.name: M:Ical.Net.IGetOccurrences.GetOccurrences(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime)
member.summary:
Returns all occurrences of this component that start on the date provided. All components starting between 12:00:00AM and 11:59:59 PM will be returned.
This will first Evaluate() the date range required in order to determine the occurrences for the date provided, and then return the occurrences.
member.param: The date for which to return occurrences.
member.returns: A list of Periods representing the occurrences of this object.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.IGetOccurrences.GetOccurrences(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime,Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime)
member.summary: Returns all occurrences of this component that overlap with the date range provided. All components that overlap with the time range between and will be returned.
member.param: The starting date range
The ending date range

member.name: M:Ical.Net.IGetOccurrencesTyped.GetOccurrences``1(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime)
member.summary:
Returns all occurrences of components of type T that start on the date provided. All components starting between 12:00:00AM and 11:59:59 PM will be returned.
This will first Evaluate() the date range required in order to determine the occurrences for the date provided, and then return the occurrences.
member.param: The date for which to return occurrences.
member.returns: A list of Periods representing the occurrences of this object.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.IGetOccurrencesTyped.GetOccurrences``1(Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime,Ical.Net.DataTypes.IDateTime)
member.summary: Returns all occurrences of components of type T that start within the date range provided. All components occurring between and will be returned.
member.param: The starting date range
The ending date range

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Utility.DateUtil.GetZone(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use this method to turn a raw string into a NodaTime DateTimeZone. It searches all time zone providers (IANA, BCL, serialization, etc) to see if the string matches. If it doesn't, it walks each provider, and checks to see if the time zone the provider knows about is contained within the target time zone string. Some older icalendar programs would generate nonstandard time zone strings, and this secondary check works around that.
member.param: A BCL, IANA, or serialization time zone identifier
If true, this method will return the system local time zone if tzId doesn't match a known time zone identifier. Otherwise, it will throw an exception.

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Utility.DateUtil.Truncate(System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Truncate to the specified TimeSpan's magnitude. For example, to truncate to the nearest second, use TimeSpan.FromSeconds(1)

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Utility.TextUtil.FoldLines(System.String)
member.summary: Folds lines at 75 characters, and prepends the next line with a space per RFC https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5545#section-3.1

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Utility.TextUtil.RemoveEmptyLines(System.String)
member.summary: Removes blank lines from a string with normalized (\r\n) line endings

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Utility.TextUtil.Normalize(System.String,Ical.Net.Serialization.SerializationContext)
member.summary:
Normalizes line endings, converting "" into "
" and "
" into "
".

member.name: M:Ical.Net.Utility.TextUtil.UnwrapLines(System.String)
member.summary: Unwraps lines from the RFC 5545 "line folding" technique.

member.name: P:Ical.Net.VTimeZoneInfo.TimeZoneName
member.summary:
Returns the name of the current Time Zone.
The following are examples:
EST
EDT
MST
MDT
